intro: Pabstia modestior, commonly known as the modest pabstia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of its family, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Pabstia modestior is considered a rare and delicate species.
